summary.p: Bullinger bothers Blarer once again. The messenger [...] delivers a package for Duke [Ulrich of] Württemberg. Bullinger believes that his preacher is named Kaspar Gräter; otherwise, Blarer should change the address. Bullinger asks Gräter to present the [“True Confession”] to the prince, and a copy is also included for Gräter. Thanks. - Regards. - [P.S.:] Bullinger asks to forward the [letter] intended for John Butler, which he kept with him for a while due to a lack of messengers; greetings to Butler.

div.p: So as not to cease being a bother to you. Behold, the messenger offers you a small package once again; I have sent it to the Duke of Württemberg. I believe his preacher is named Kaspar Gräter; if I am mistaken, I beg you to wrap my letters with yours and address them correctly. I ask him to present the example along with the letters to the prince; I have also given him a copy. You, with your faith and diligence, take care of these matters diligently.
Farewell. Remember us in your prayers.
Please ensure that these addressed to John Butler are received by him promptly; I have kept them with me for several days because I could not find a messenger. Greet him in my name.
To the most distinguished man, Ambrosius Blarer, Bishop of Constance, his esteemed lord and dearest brother. Constance.
